author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...LIFE-THREATENING STORM SURGE, DAMAGING WINDS, AND FLOODING RAINS  EXPECTED TONIGHT FOR PARTS OF CENTRAL AND SOUTHWESTERN FLORIDA... ...600 PM EDT POSITION UPDATE...
summary:
...LIFE-THREATENING STORM SURGE, DAMAGING WINDS, AND FLOODING RAINS  EXPECTED TONIGHT FOR PARTS OF CENTRAL AND SOUTHWESTERN FLORIDA... ...600 PM EDT POSITION UPDATE...
 As of 6:00 PM EDT Wed Oct 9
 the center of Milton was located near 27.0, -83.3
 with movement NE at 15 mph.
 The minimum central pressure was 948 mb
 with maximum sustained winds of about 120 mph.

title: Summary - Hurricane Milton (AT4/AL142024)
